conbody.note: You will have to connect the microphone to the computer audio interface first (usually it's the red connector on the interface) before starting to set it up for Windows 8/10.
conbody.p: Open the Control Panel ( ) window to set up the microphone for Windows 8/10. This can be accomplished by right clicking on the Start button or pressing Win + X on you keyboard and selecting Control panel in the menu.
Select Hardware and Sound in the Control Panel window and then selectSound.
Select Recording tab in the Sound ( ) window that appears on your display. Then select the microphone and press the Properties button.
You will be presented with the Microphone Properties window ( ). Select the General tab and make sure that Device usage is set to Use this device (enable).

fig.title: General tab of the Microphone Properties window

image.alt: General tab of the Microphone Properties window

conbody.p: Select Levels tab ( ) to set up microphone level and boost its gain (if necessary).

fig.title: Levels tab of the Microphone Properties window

image.alt: Levels tab of the Microphone Properties window

conbody.p: Select Enhancements ( ) tab to set up additional microphone features, such as noise suppression, echo cancellation, etc.

fig.title: Enhancements tab of the Microphone Properties window

image.alt: Enhancements tab of the Microphone Properties window

conbody.note: Microphone additional features and enhancements depend on the type of the audio interface in your computer.
conbody.p: Press OK button to finish microphone setup.
